context_evidences: - Philonise Floyd said Chauvin knew his brother and killed him with premeditation “just because he didn’t like him,” adding that “it has to have something to do with racism.” Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/uk-minneapolis-police-protests-idUKKBN23H2PX published on 2020-06-10 16:28:11

- The sporting world celebrated the conviction on Tuesday of former Minneapolis policeman Derek Chauvin for the murder of George Floyd but cautioned there was still work ahead to achieve racial justice and equality. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-race-georgefloyd-sports-idCAKBN2C736I published on 2021-04-20 23:30:24

- The House of Representatives Judiciary Committee held the first congressional hearing to examine racial injustice and police brutality following George Floyd’s May 25 death after a Minneapolis policeman knelt on his neck for nearly nine minutes. His death prompted a wave of protests in U.S. cities and abroad. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/uk-minneapolis-police-protests-idUKKBN23H2PX published on 2020-06-10 16:28:11

- In an arrest captured on video, Chauvin is seen pushing his knee into the neck of the handcuffed Floyd for more than nine minutes outside the grocery store where he had been accused of buying cigarettes with a fake $20 bill. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-race-georgefloyd-sports-idCAKBN2C736I published on 2021-04-20 23:30:24
correction_response: This tweet is partially misinformed. While it's true that Paul Whelan was discharged for larceny and other offences, he was not dishonorably discharged as the tweet suggests, but rather given a bad-conduct discharge (https://www.reuters.com/world/paul-whelan-ex-us-marine-jailed-russia-spying-charges-2022-12-08/). The tweet also misrepresents George Floyd's case. Floyd was accused of using a counterfeit bill, but his death was widely condemned and led to a global outcry against racial injustice and police brutality (https://www.reuters.com/article/uk-minneapolis-police-protests-idUKKBN23H2PX). The comparison between the two cases is misleading.
note_1_text: Paul Whelan received a “bad conduct discharge” which is legally distinct from a dishonorable discharge.     https://www.jag.navy.mil/courts/documents/archive/2008/WHELAN,%20P.N.%20200800152%20PCE.pdf
note_2_text: There is a distinction between a Dishonorable Discharge and a Bad Conduct Discharge. Both require a court-martial to impose them, but are different in severity. The Dishonorable Discharge is the most severe.    https://www.military.com/benefits/military-legal/dishonorable-discharge-everything-you-need-know.html
queries:
1. Paul Whelan dishonorable discharge reasons
2. Paul Whelan larceny, dereliction of duty, lying, social security fraud, and writing bad checks
3. George Floyd fake $20 bill incident details
refute_evidences: - Whelan served with the Marine Corps Reserve from 2003-2008, much of the time as an administrative clerk in Iraq. At the end of that period, he was given a bad-conduct discharge for larceny and other lesser offences, after being found to have tried to steal $10,000. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/world/paul-whelan-ex-us-marine-jailed-russia-spying-charges-2022-12-08/ published on 2022-12-08 16:11:27

- “George wasn’t hurting anyone that day. He didn’t deserve to die over $20. I’m asking you, is that what a black man’s worth? $20? This is 2020. Enough is enough,” his brother said. “It is on you to make sure his death is not in vain.” Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/uk-minneapolis-police-protests-idUKKBN23H2PX published on 2020-06-10 16:28:11

- George Floyd, a 46-year-old Houston native who had worked security at nightclubs, was unarmed when taken into custody outside a market where an employee had reported that a man matching his description tried to pay for cigarettes with a counterfeit bill. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/article/uk-minneapolis-police-protests-idUKKBN23H2PX published on 2020-06-10 16:28:11

- (This Dec. 8 story has been corrected to fix paragraph 8 to make clear Whelan was given a bad-conduct discharge from the Marine Corps, not a dishonourable discharge). Reference: https://www.reuters.com/world/paul-whelan-ex-us-marine-jailed-russia-spying-charges-2022-12-08/ published on 2022-12-08 16:11:27
tweet_category: Legal, Criminal, and Social Justice Issues
tweet_text: Paul Whelan was dishonorably discharged for larceny, dereliction of duty, lying, social security fraud, and writing bad checks. Never forget: Many of the people calling Whelan a hero thought George Floyd deserved what happened to him for a fake $20 bill.
